reviews.text: I have visited this hotel on numerous occasions since it first opened, each time has outclassed the previous. Most recent was 28/08/2011 a family wedding, the building improvements are in the final stages and it is a stunning hidden gem. The staff are brilliant, nothing is too much trouble and they work their socks off. Thank-you for making what was a lovely day into fabulous day 10/10
reviews.title: fantastic venue

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed over one night following the Wedding Reception of our friends daughter. What a delight ! Room was to a very high standard - modern and well equipped - although the remote control for the lighting did fox us at first - and was a bit tricky to find and operate in the middle of the night ! The Reception service and meal were very good and everything went very smoothly. All the dining room and bar area are very attractive - and the light fittings in particular are amazing. There is obviously a project to build some more outside at the back - but the gardens were very pleasant and well manicured. A lovely comfortable place and everyone felt very relaxed and looked after. Breakfast the next morning was good and despite a bit of fun with a reluctant card machine the checkout was pleasant and smooth. Well situated in a very pleasant are for strolling and seeing Port Sunlight, Museum, Art gallery etc.
reviews.title: Lovely Wedding Reception , attentive staff, good standard of rooms

reviews.text: I stayed on business for two month and am very surprised about the hotel and service. Super choice of wine, good food, modern rooms. Will definitely return again
reviews.title: Very nice experience in a such small village

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights - a room for the kids and a room for me and Jane. The rooms are very well equipped indeed and very modern - chique i think is the word for them - but a bit overlooked and noisy in the evening as they face the wedding venue. Cooked breakfast spoiled as the chef seemed to poor salt over it so kit was inedible but service and surroundings great. Also ate at the restaurant - had the tasting menu - the chef tried very hard and many of the courses were excellent. Overall- somewhere as a great wedding venue and to stay if yiou are attending a function there.
reviews.title: lovely rooms, nice staff but not quite up to the mark - yet....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have been very underwhelmed by our recent dinner. We arrived to find we were the only people dining-apart from staff we did not see another guest all evening. Sitting in uncomfortable seats we were presented with dog eared menus-mine was stained.
reviews.title: We won't be back

reviews.text: Idly turning on the television in your room and being confronted immediately with a screenful of hard core pornography comes as a shock. That was my introduction to this place. Room is well decorated, badly equipped, no tea/coffee making facility, for example. Phone is on desk out of reach of the bed, making responding to morning alarm call difficult. Lighting is controlled by complex remote control -- no switches -- impossible to fathom out. TV made up for the porn by having many of its pitiably small choice of channels (among them a mere two radio channels) providing "snowflake" infested pictures -- and in any case the sound did not work (apart from a 2-minute burst). Bed has child's large cuddly toy on top of pillow, with infuriatingly coy message on label around its neck. Yuck!
reviews.title: Leverhulme Hotel and Spa

reviews.text: My dinner was good; others found their steaks inedibly tough. Breakfast was a disaster. A lacklustre help-yourself display of cereals, breads, cheese and hams, a near-empty jug of orange juice that was never replenished once it had been emptied. No menu for the cooked breakfast, but an assurance that they could do anything. Not the requested kipper, they couldn't. Smoked haddock was claimed to be available, but what was served -- swimming in a sea of water -- was both tough and tasteless and bore no resemblance to smoked haddock. Inedible. The accompanying requested poached egg had been overcooked. White toast was asked for; two slices of slightly warmed (yes really!) white bread were served and sent back to be re-toasted. Butter was straight from a very cold fridge and rocklike. A colleague's tea failed to appear at all until, after a long wait, it is re-ordered.
reviews.title: Checked Out Early

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place has won awards. I can't conceive how. A dreadful hotel, to be avoided, despite the friendly staff.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way!

reviews.text: I was recently in Port Sunlight on business and was actually looking forward to staying in this hotel after visiting their website and reading reviews. I wanted to start my day with a visit to the gym and spa, but was told that neither would be open for the foreseeable future. This struck me as odd considering the hotel claims it is a "Hotel & Spa". While a bit confusing, it wasn't a deal-breaker. The next morning the hotel experienced some sort of power issue as there was no hot water and my traveling companion lost all power to his room. Again, I tried to be optimistic - a cold shower is an invigorating way to start the day, right? I was dismayed, however, when my complaints to the manager were met with chuckles and half-hearted apologies. No adjustment was made to my bill, no offers of any kind were made. I spent the rest of my visit in a hotel in Liverpool. I will never stay at the Leverhulme again, nor will I ever recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Leverhulme last night with my partner, neither of us wanted to leave! We have been spoilt rotten! The room was spotless, quirky, modern and beautiful with everything we could possibly need.
reviews.title: Would go back for food, strange hotel?

reviews.text: Leverhulme have looked to maintain 1930s charm with modern convenience and they have almost got this right. The problem is with the modern - every extra costs - from water, to breakfast etc. We paid £140 for the night, breakfast was extra and our 'extra light room with windows' was on the ground floor and the windows were 'whited' out for privacy.
reviews.title: Wonderful wedding, renovated accommodation

reviews.text: I cannot recommend the accommodation - the bed was a cheap mattress covered with lovely linen, the bathroom tiles where not quite right, the 1930s furniture is lovely but the modern additions jarr - it smacks of rushed work done on the cheap.
reviews.title: Fantastic! December 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend's wedding was lovely - she was radiant!
reviews.title: Wedding 19.08.11

reviews.text: We went to ate at Richard Fox at The Leverhulme Hotel for a friends birthday. Its a must! The food is unreal and staff are friendly and happy to help with anything.
reviews.title: Very good, until..............

reviews.text: We will definately be going back very soon!
reviews.title: Unfinished Hotel, Broken Promises, Terrible Management
What a dream place
reviews.text: Beautiful, friendly, welcoming experience with food to die for. This is the old Cottage Hospital in Port Sunlight - the restaurant is absolutely perfect - good weather and you can eat outside with all the wonderful service that is available inside. Every guest is made to feel very special. The staff are perfect, just enough attention. Every need catered for to precision. A very, very special location with vintage cars sometimes on show from their fleet used for weddings and chauffeur services. This is one place I revisit when I am on The Wirral - a pure little gem, one in a million.

reviews.title: Mr and Mrs Griffin's Beautiful Wedding
reviews.text: Wonderful location in the village of Port Sunlight. Brilliant venue, excellent service and food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very apprehensive when we booked two years ago but our very own Victoria and David had the most wonderful wedding day thanks to the excellent wedding planner, Amanda and the hard work of Charles and his attentive staff on the day. The room looked wonderful, our guests truly enjoyed every aspect of the day from the drinks reception right through to the party in the evening. The food was excellent and the service was spot-on. The bride and groom could not have asked for a better day.
reviews.title: Our daughter's fabulous wedding day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went jogging around Port Sunlight and came across Leverhulme Hotel, and wanted to pop in for a look around. The staff immediately welcomed us in despite our casual (very) sportswear. So, not only being impressed by first impressions, but also of this local hidden gem, my husband booked a table the next evening!
reviews.title: A great evening, beautiful surroundings and delicious food.

reviews.text: What a great night it was! The building and surroundings were beautiful and luxurious and the service was absolutely fantastic, plus the food was excellent, to a very high quality. Again, so impressed with our evening here for food and drinks, we decided to book a room for my birthday, after the staff showed us one suite-it was fabulous. Although we live very local, we felt like we were on holiday, as it was such a special service we received. We recommend this local gem, a great alternative to fine food and drinks in Liverpool, plus supporting our local businesses. Cant wait till my birthday, i know it will be a very special day being wined and dined here in Leverhulme Hotel. Watch this space for review of our stay!
reviews.title: Beautiful day..
